title: 111_hr1351
content:
The Act titled "Savings Enhancement for Education in College Act" allows computer technology and equipment to be considered as qualified higher education expenses for Section 529 accounts. The Act allows expenses for computer technology, equipment, and Internet access for the designated beneficiary at an eligible educational institution to be considered as qualified higher education expenses for Section 529 accounts. The software is mainly educational. The amendments apply to expenses after December 31, 2010. SEC. 3. CREDIT FOR CONTRIBUTIONS TO 529 PLANS. The amendment to section 25B of the Internal Revenue Code includes contributions to qualified tuition programs as part of qualified savings contributions, provided the taxpayer has control over the account and the beneficiary is the taxpayer. The taxpayer, spouse, or eligible individual can make qualified savings contributions, limited by compensation and adjusted gross income. Adjusted gross income is increased by the excess of social security benefits received over the amount included in gross income for the year. The text amends various sections of the Code related to retirement savings, including changing "qualified retirement savings" to "qualified savings" and updating headings and subparagraphs. The table of sections for subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code is amended by replacing the item for section 25B with a new item. SEC. 25B - Elective deferrals, IRA contributions, and qualified tuition program contributions by certain individuals. Effective Date: Contributions made after December 31, 2009.

SEC. 4 - Investment direction under qualified tuition programs. Amends section 529(b) of the Internal Revenue Code to allow investment direction changes more frequently than 2 times per calendar year. Effective Date: Years beginning after December 31, 2008.
